dtliExcerpt: As Dr. Thomas Stockmann, the much-antagonized protagonist of Henrik Ibsen’s “An Enemy of the People,” and perhaps the first theatrical whistleblower, Jeremy Strong gives a performance of sustained, contained intensity that keeps this intimate, refreshing revival continually absorbing.
showScoreExcerpt: Mr. Strong brings a ferocious intensity to the role of Dr. Stockmann that serves both the character and the production well, even if his sometimes mannered approach occasionally threatens to tip into caricature.
